main event: A bright orange object was observed in the sky near Astoria, Missouri on November 7, 1957.
interesting points: The observation lasted 10 minutes,Only one object was reported,The brightness of the object was described as 'very bright',Northwest of the observation site, there was reported mist, rain, and thunderstorms during the sightings,Insufficient data led to conclusions requiring further evaluation.
witness description: Three witnesses reported the incident, but their credibility was questioned due to poor conditions and potential distractions.
